title: If the CP of 21 oranges is equal to the SP of 18 oranges, then what is the profit percent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Simple job. Let cp of 21 oranges be 21 ₹ . So cp of one orange is ₹1. Now sp of 18 oranges is 21, so one orange is sold for 21/18 i.e. 7/6 . so profit per orange is 7/6 -1= 1/6 So % profit will be 1/6 ×100 =16.67. Otherwise there's profit of 3 oranges over 18 i.e.1/6 =16.67%
CP of 21 orange = X CP of 1 orange= X/21 SP of 18 orange = X SP of 1 orange= X/18 Profit = sp-cp= X/126 Profit% = (profit/cp)*100= ((X/126)/(X/21))*100% =2100/126%= 100/6%= 50/3%= 16.67%

If the CP of 21 oranges is equal to the SP of 18 oranges, then what is the profit percent? Solution: SP of 1 orange = 21/18 times the CP of 1 orange. Profit % = [(21/18) -18/18]*100/(18/18) = (1.167–1)*100/1 = 16.7%. Answer.
